interestingFact: Japan has more than 6,800 islands, but most people live on just four main ones.
Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world, stretching over 202,080 km.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, which produces 20% of the world's oxygen.
Australia is the only continent without an active volcano.
India is the world's largest democracy with over 900 million eligible voters.
Russia spans 11 time zones, the most of any country in the world.
Egypt is home to one of the oldest civilizations and the Great Pyramid of Giza is one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
South Africa has three capital cities: Pretoria, Bloemfontein, and Cape Town.
China is home to the world's largest man-made structure, the Great Wall of China.
The United States has the world's largest economy by nominal GDP.
